name: PartyLose
commands: # Lose game when party size falls below three
You have lost too many members of your party.

name: House
commands: Hmmm... You're fighting the Empire?|Hmmph. Brave fools.|Take this. You're gonna need it.

name: House1
commands: Hmmm... you're not the one the boss usually sends...|... Ah,don't want to talk?|I understand.|In this business, it pays to keep your mouth shut, eh?|Speaking of payment, I've got the money, just as promised.|You tell the boss not to worry, ol' Saint's taken care of the job.

name: House2
commands: Oh is that you, Billy?|Its been ages since I last saw you. How are ya doing, Billy?{w}{clear}You know me, I've been doing well -- keeping to myself.|Trying to keep the house clean, y'know.|Have you heard about the weather recently? I've heard it might rain soon...{w}{clear}Oh but do you hear me go on! How are you and the missus?{w}{clear}Are you taking good care of Sally? She's such a darling grandniece.{w}{clear}Well don't let me keep ya. Here take this for the road.

name: House3
commands: How'd you manage to get past those Imperial forces?|Well, anyone brave or foolish enough to fight the Empire deserves a reward.|Here, take this.|This should help if you're going to fight that shaman.

name: Turn3
commands: We've managed to outflank them! Hurry and we'll see victory!

name: Outro
commands: I reckon now would be the proper time for introductions.|The name's Joel, and the sour face is my partner Nia.
I'm Prim and this is Ophie.|T-Thank you for helping us.
No problem, lass. Though, if you don't mind my pryin'...|I've been wonderin'...|What in the hell did ya'll do to rouse Ulver's thugs after you?
Hmmph! What did we do?!|They're the ones that attacked us!|They stormed the monastery, claiming we had some fugitive or something.
M-master Yohn, Ophie, and I tried to escape...|Bu-But Master Yohn went back... t-to hold them off...|H-He died for us.
Lass... you're safe now.|Your master's sacrifice had a purpose, right?
I'll let ya'll in on a little secret.|I reckon ya'll already figured that Nia and I ain't rangers.|We're actually with the Resistance.

We're... daggumit, how does Sam phrase it...|freedom fighters!|The Empire's had its way with our country for too long.|We're aimin' to take it back!{w}{clear}Anyways, since ya'll don't have anywhere to go, why don't ya'll head back with me?
You bet!|And we could always use new members.|You're a competant swordsman.
And, lassie, we could certainly use a healer.|Sam has his hands full as it is.
Count me in!|Prim, what do you say?|This could be our chance to avenge Master Yohn!
W-we don't have anywhere else to go, and if we'll be helping Kerala...
Then, how can I say no?
Sounds like a plan!|I'll get Nia, and we'll be off!

name: Intro
commands: The Resistance base is a little yonder.{w}{clear}Normally I'd stop at the village here for supplies,|but I think gettin' ya'll to the base takes precedence.
Don't burden yourself on our account.
How come we've never heard of your Resistance before?|The monks never spoke of an organized resistance.
Prim, if we're joining this Resistance, I want to know everything about it.|We're goin' to be putting our lives on the line!
The lad's right, Prim. Ya'll deserve to know.|Honestly, we ain't been so successful lately.|We don't have the manpower to fight the Empire openly,|and our latest missions have been turning up blanks.
But there's no cause for concern!|Between ya'll and Sam's new allies, I reckon things are lookin' up!
Aah!|Nia! You startled me.|What did I tell ya 'bout creepin' up on people?
A ruckus in Podoma?|We'd better skirt around the village, then.
Hey, Ophie! Lad!|Where you goin'? Don't run off!
Don't you want to see what's up?
That sounds... dangerous.|I reckon we should do the smart thing and walk around the fighting.
Hmmph. I thought you were freedom fighters, not cowards.
Come on, Prim.|Let's go see what's up.
Damn. 'Reckon somebody's gotta watch them...|Let's follow, Nia. This ain't goin' to end well.
# Pan to village. Pan over to Althea and Drake fighting Imperial Soldiers
Milady, I'm sorry.|In the end, my strength was not enough to protect you.
Drake, you've done so much for me.|Run.... it's me they're after... you can save yourself.
Never!|Death is no punishment compared to the shame of failure.|Stay back, and allow me this last shred of dignity.
Do not worry, Althea.|I still have some fight left.
He is taking on all those Imperials alone.
It looks like he's protecting that girl.
Does he have a death wish?|He's got no chance against that horde.
He won't be alone for long!
What! More traitors come out of the woodwork!|Who would've thought that Keralan loyalty to the old crown would've held this long...|Bah, kill them all! And take no prisoners!
Yes, you idiot!|Do you think the Duke wants to keep her as a reminder of his failings?
When this day is done, the Empire's hold in Kerala will finally be secured!

name: Turn2
commands: Do not worry yourself, milady.|The sight of your loyal subjects, defending Kerala's pride with their lives...|It would bring any man to tears.
Well, while you do that, I'm going to help!
I can defend myself, Drake. You can help if you wish.
# So they don't start charging immediately

name: Armory
commands: Iron Sword,Iron Lance,Slim Lance,Iron Axe,Hatchet,Willow Bow

name: Talk
commands: Hey, miss! What's going on?|Why are these goons after you?
We don't have time for pleasantries, Althea.
Shush Drake.|Thank you for your timely help. I am truly grateful.
We can handle ourselves now.|You had best run, and quick.|I don't want to see anyone else harmed on my account.
What!|Lass, you think we're just going to turn tail and run while ya'll are in danger?|Just leave these thugs to us, alright?
We can handle these damned imperials.
Wait! One moment.|Watch out for their leader, Brigham.|He might look weak, but he's skilled in sorcery.
I'll keep an eye out, lass.
Uh... One of the Imperials dropped it?
Lad, quit your lollygagging.|We've got Imperial skulls to crack.
We'll follow, Drake.|I won't have them defend me alone.
If you think it is best, milady.

name: SamKileyTalk
commands: Hey, you look like you're in charge of the prisoners here.
Eh, wot, matey?|I didn't catch ya. Speak up!|All this commotion, y'hear.
I said, you're in the charge of the prisoners here, right.
I'm Sam. The leader of the Resistance.|We just freed you.
Oy! And now you want something.|Aye, matey, I catch yer drift.
We could use your help dealing with the rest of the guards.
No can do, matey.|I got me own crew.|But come talk to me after the battle, and maybe we can hash out a deal.
I don't know why I thought this would be easier...

name: SamCoyoteTalk
commands: I'll take that as a yes...|Uh... We could use your help, since you know the place.
Way ahead of you. Wait here.|I'll handle the warden myself.
I'm not sure that's such a good idea.|Why don't we come up with a plan, instead of going in guns blazing?
Look, I get it. You're new at this.|Trust me. I'm a professional.
No actually, I'm not new, I've been doing this for a while--

name: KaylaCoyoteTalk
commands: Ah Coyote. Fancy seeing you here.
You know, your job performance has been lacking lately.|No reports since the last moon!
It's something of an occupational hazard.
Well, I'll be keeping a better eye on you from now on.
I don't need the Confederacy breathing down my neck.
Oh, don't worry. This is personal.
Tsk Tsk. Don't get so bent out of shape, Coyote.|I'm sure you could use a break from that loner persona.
Enough talk.|I've got a warden to kill.
Wait up.|You're going to need this.

name: OphieCoyoteTalk
commands: Hey, kid. Where'd you learn that stance?
Your sword stance.|Who taught you it?
A monk, eh?|Well, you're doing your teacher a disservice.
What! No, I'm not.|I was taught by the best!
I guess you didn't listen.|Hold your wrist up higher.|There.
How'd you know how to do that?|Were you a monk?
Now's no time for stories, kid.

name: Outro
commands: We can't thank you enough.|If you hadn't arrived when you did...
My sincerest apologies.|I am ever in your debt.
Oh, don't mention it!|We Keralans should help each other in these troubled times.
I mean it. Honest!|If everyone lived that way, the world would be a much better place.
Oh, I didn't mean to question your honesty...|I-it's just, I feel like I've seen you before.|But I could swear I've never met you.
Hmm. It's probably nothing to fret over.
Now I remember!|Your picture... it was carved on the Lion's Wall at the monastery!
It must be someone else, Prim.|That carving has to be decades old...
And anyway, Master Yohn said everyone on that wall died in the Empire's purge.
...Your master was correct.|They are all dead.
I think you've said enough.|Thank you for the help, but you're upsetting my lady.
No, Drake. I can handle myself.|...That's my mother you recognize.
The queen?|Then... you're the queen's daughter?
But all of the royalty were executed after the invasion.
They were, except me.|With Drake's aid, I managed to escape.|...I, alone among my family, survived the purge, for all the good that's done.|Drake and I have been on the run ever since.
So you're the one the Duke's been looking for!|You're the fugitive!
Yes. Capturing her is the Empire's last step in securing Kerala.
Then, we can't let them find you!|You have to come with us.|We'll get you to the Resistance base.
It's gotta be the safest place in all of Kerala for you.
If they're telling the truth, milady,|it would mean an end to all this running.
Hmmm... I'll trust your word, um...
Oh, sorry, your highness.|I'm Ophie and this is Prim.
I-it's an honor to meet you, princess Althea.
Please, don't be so formal.|I can't convince Drake to call me Althea,|but I couldn't bear to have anyone else be so stiff.
Will do, Althea!|Then let's scram, before any more Imperial thugs show up.

name: Intro
commands: This is the Resistance base?! But it's so... small.
It is rather cozy, ain't it?{w}{clear}Anyway, let's talk to Sam.|He'll know what to do with the lot of you.
Our tactician. The brains behind this whole operation.{w}{clear}Now, I must warn ya'll.|Not every one o' my esteemed colleagues is as friendly,{w} handsome,{w} and good-natured as I.
It's a hard life in the Resistance.|Just look at Nia.|Nia?|Damnation. She disappeared again.
Nia doesn't talk much, does she?
Nope. But I talk enough for the both of us.|Besides, the lass has other ways of getting her point across...|as ya'll almost found out.
Good to see you as well, partner.
Sure did. I'll have them explain.
S-Sir, my name is Prim and this is Ophie.|We'd like to join your, ah, Resistance.
Hmmph. You're barely more than children.|What use are you to the Resistance?
I can fight!|You will not find my blade lacking!
Also, I am trained in the healing arts...
Sam, they have nowhere else to turn to.
I can vouch for them.|They saved me from a group of Imperial soldiers.
And who might you be, girl--{w}{clear}Wait. I recognize you.|It can't be...
It is, sir.|You see before you the rightful heir to the Lion Throne.
So... can they join your Resistance?
What?|Oh... of course.|Sorry, your highness. It's just surprising news.|This changes everything. All my plans...|But I'm getting ahead of myself...|Your highness, please take a seat.
Althea, then. We have a lot to discuss...
Well, come along then. I don't think Sam needs us anymore.|I reckon' ya'll could use a tour.|I'll introduce you to the other members o' this fine establishment...
As you all can see, we have some new members.|I foresee good fortune in our future.|Now, we'll be able to take the fight to the Imperial interlopers!
Yeah, yeah, Sam.|You give us the same prep talk before every mission.|Just tell it to us straight.
Fine. Theo has informed me that we're running low on funds.|We need money for repairs, new armor, and so on.|So...{w} we're gonna rob the Imperial Bank.
Rob a bank? We'll be regarded as nothing more than common thugs.|What honor can be found in that?

This is no ordinary bank.|The Empire imposes harsh taxes on the Keralan people.|Their blood money is kept in Fort Kosheen before being sent to the Empire proper.|We'll be... liberating this unearned revenue from the Empire.|Surely you can see the honor in that, Drake?
But won't this fort be heavily guarded?
Normally, yes.|But my sources assure me that the guard at Fort Kosheen will be light tonight.|They will be having other... troubles.|Leaving the treasure for us.
Hah! A heist against the Empire!|This is what being in the Resistance is all about, eh, Prim?
Well, then, sounds like a plan.|I'm fixin' to get me some breakfast.|Who's with me?
I wish you good luck this evening, everyone.
Just like Sam said, the guards are leaving...
I reckon' we'd best make this quick.|Who knows how long they'll be.
Oh, you can count on me to make this quick.|They don't call me the best thief in Kerala for nothing.
I doubt that anybody refers to you as that, Renae.
Sure they do.|Really, Theo, you need to get out more.
Hmmm...|Wouldn't being called the best thief in Kerala falsify that very statement?
The best thief should be sneaky, right?
So the best thief in Kerala should be someone nobody knows about...
Yet, here I am, living proof!|La-dee-da!
Enough talk. Now's the time to strike.

name: Turn1
commands: I wonder what got the Sarge all riled up.
'Ey, don't worry about him.|We finally get some time to relax without him breathing down our neck.
I tell ya.|He catches me napping on duty once, and I'm shoveling shit for a week.
Man, I could really use a break though...|...Hey... can you cover for me...|I'm going to take a quick nap while he's gone.
You're still single!|You don't know what its like with two kids at home.|I can't remember the last time I got a full night's rest.
Hmm... all right, but you owe me one.

name: Turn2
commands: The Resistance! Those traitorous scum...|Men, to arms! We cannot allow them into the vault.
And send a runner to Sergeant Harold.|We need backup! These Resistance scum must be put down!

name: Turn4
commands: On your feet, soldier! The Resistance is here!
I finally get a chance to take one nap and all hell breaks loose!|Just my luck...

name: Turn9
commands: Escape the Fort or Defeat Boss
Men, double time! Fan out and surround the Fort.|Don't let a single robber escape!|We shall not fail the Empire.
Oh no. Those soldiers were not gone for very long.|We need to run!
You don't have to tell me twice!|Catch you all later!

name: SwitchCenter
commands: Yeah, yeah! Lockpicking isn't as easy as I make it look.
Hurry, we don't have much time!

name: ChestCenter
commands: Okay, we've got the loot!|Let's scram!
Escape the Fort OR Defeat Boss

name: Outro
commands: Then we can rest here, but only for a little.|It's a long walk back to base.
Hmmph. That was too close!|Sam said we weren't going to have to worry about the guards!
That asshole's plan nearly got us killed.|And he doesn't even show up!|Who does he think he is?
I-I'm sure he had a good reason.|He just made a mistake.|This is a fluke, right?
I'll give Sam one more chance.|If our so-called tactician's plan fails again, Prim and I are done.
... Uh...|N-No use dawdling around here, right?|A long rest will do everyone some good.

name: Ophie meets Renae
commands: Sit down!|Try some of this goulash! It's fantastic!
Renae, I cooked that goulash... for myself.
I know and it is delicious!|Now stop interrupting me.|Try some!
Eat it, its good for you.|...Probably.
Huh? You shouldn't talk with your mouth full, y'know.
Slow down, Renae.|Give the lad some time to compose himself, eh?
Ophie! Nice to meet ya. I'm Renae!|I'm this group's, uh, subterfuge specialist!
Joel! I didn't want this kid to get the wrong idea!
No, I understand.|You guys steal from the Empire, and give back to the common folk, right?
Uh... right!|Well, when we can.|Sam hasn't had us doing too much of that lately though.|Anyway, you're a swordsman, I take it?
I was trained by the Rusonoon Monks, the best in Kerala.
Ah!|What the hell was that for?
Don't act so grouchy...|Just testing your reflexes.
Yeah! Luckily, you passed.|Here take this.
Hey! This is no ordinary sword!|This baby'll cut through the toughest armor like its butter!|It'll come in handy.
Well, now, off you go!|Let me finish my goulash in peace!

name: Prim meets Eliza
commands: She's gotta be hidin' around here somewhere...
It's not a big deal if I don't meet her now, Joel.|I'm sure I'll get a chance later.
I said I'd introduce you to the crew, and I don't break my promises.|Eliza!
I've brought someone for you to meet.
Uh, nice to meet you.|I'm Prim.|...I-I guess I'm the newest member of this group.
Well, I'll let you two get to know one another!
Uh... Its a beautiful day, isn't it?
What are your skills?|What do you bring to the group?|We don't need anybody else weighing us down.
I guess, well, I'm a cleric, so... I can heal.
We already have a healer.|We don't need another.
Then let's see what you got.

name: Ophie meets Theo
commands: Open up Theo.|There's someone here for you to meet.
Joel, ol' chap, must you always interrupt me while I'm reading?|What is it now?|Oh pardon my manners. You have a guest.
A pleasure. Well, don't just stand in the doorway...|Please come in.
Welcome to my humble abode.|So you're our newest recruit, then?|You look a little young, eh?
Hah! I don't doubt such a fiery rebuttal.
So...|what do you do here, then, Theo?
Many things, Ophie, many things.|The Resistance is not just a combat unit.|Someone needs to handle other mundane matters--|food, weapon repair, logistics, etcetera.
Hah!|I quite like that...|As you can see, I do enjoy a good read now and again. And you?
What use are books in a fight?
Why, books have so much to tell us!|They are veritable fonts of knowledge.
Not the kind of knowledge I'm looking for.
Hmmm.... you're a man of the sword, I take it?
Well, I might just have a book you'd be interested in.|Now where is it...
A book on combat.|If you study it, perhaps your skills will improve.
Well, I'll see.|The Rusonoon monks also loved their books.
You've stayed with the Rusonoon monks?|I've always hoped to visit their library...
Hmmm... Theo, ol'chap.|That could have gone better.

name: Turn1
commands: Ah! Ancient ruins, here?|They might hold interest for my research.|The others won't notice if I take a short break, right?

name: Turn2
commands: Ah! T-There are bandits to the south!|My precious cargo!
Hmph! Those are no ordinary bandits.|It's the Resistance! To arms, men!
We cannot allow the Resistance to capture this cargo.|This is Imperial property!|Defend this cargo with your lives!

name: Turn4
commands: Look out! Wyverns to the west!

name: Turn5
commands: This isn't working!|You, soldier, attend me!
We have to retreat. Order everyone back.
Shut yer mouth, you swaddled pig.|I will not disappoint the Duke.|We will lay down our lives in his name!
T-There has to be another way!
They've already struck down some of my best wagons!
You sniveling craven.|Out of my way!

name: Intro
commands: # So Eliza doesn't show up in the base menu
Well done everyone.|Thanks to your valiant efforts, we have the funds we need to keep our struggle alive.|But we can't stop now.
I know the last mission did not go as well as we had hoped.
According to my sources, a weapon shipment is due to reach the Imperials.|We cannot allow those weapons to reach Duke Ulver.

Yes, but it should only be a token force.|The Empire is keeping these shipments on the down-low.{w}{clear}Capturing these weapons will not only strike a blow against the Empire,|but will also aid the Resistance in our future endeavors.|This mission is of paramount importance!
If no one else has any comments...
Can you let me join this fight?
What? Out of the question, Eliza.|You are not ready.
I am ready!|I can do it. I know I can.
Please, Sam. I've been training...|I'm stronger than I was then. I won't get hurt.
You really don't trust me anymore, do you!
Well, um,|this has been an eventful meeting, but,{w} uh...|if we're going to catch those caravans, we'd better get ready, right?
Cover for me. I'll catch up with you guys in a little.
What could she be up to?
How'd ya convince Sam to let you off the leash, lass?
I'd have bet that Sam would never relent.
What'd you say to him, anyway?|He's usually so protective...
Eh? You sayin' you're not supposed to be here?
Please, Joel. Let me stay.|I really want to fight!
Ahahaha! You reckon' I'd send you back?|Nah, if you say you're ready...|Welcome back to the team, lass.
Though, when Sam hears about this, he'll be furious.
Don't worry, Eliza.|Once we succeed here, how could Sam claim you're not strong enough?
I guess.|I don't want him mad at me, though.
You've trained for this.|You'll do great!
Enough chatter.|To your positions! The caravan approaches!

name: No More Wagons
commands: You haven't won yet, Resistance scum.|I'll take your scalps back to the Duke myself!

name: Outro
commands: # From this point on, all enemies are at +1 level
Wow! Look at all this loot!
With this many weapons, the Resistance should be set for quite a while.
So Nia, anything catching your eye?
# Give Nia a new bow Oak Bow
Althea, don't touch that! These are Imperial weapons...|They could be dangerous!
Always a worrier.|Come on Drake, live a little.
Joel, you ever seen a sword like this before?|It was wrapped up by itself in the back.
Well, lad, it's certainly ornate.|How does it feel?
I don't like the look of it.
No... I just have a bad feeling.
I reckon' I've heard of this blade before.|This is ancient magic.|Lad, what you hold in your hands is a Magebane Sword.
A blade that devours magic.|That must be why Althea and Prim feel sick.
Please, Ophie, now that we know what it is, can you put it back?|I feel like I'm going to throw up.
Don't throw it away though, lad.|A sword like that could come in handy.
Alright, everyone. Let's get a move on.|The wagon's fully loaded.

name: An Uneasy Trust
commands: Uh... what's that supposed to mean?|The monks taught me all about--
No, boy.|Do you have faith in the Resistance?|Do you believe that we can succeed?|That we can cleanse these Imperial scum from our land?
I was made aware of your outburst yesterday...|So I'll ask again.|Do you have faith?
...No.|I guess I don't have faith in your Resistance...|But I want to see the Empire crushed, same as you!|I lost my home to the Empire!|Why else would I even be here?
Last night, I was tired.|The plan failed and you weren't even there...|My emotions got the better of me.
You understand I can't have my soldiers doubting my orders.|In battle, one hesitation, one mistake, and it's over.
Yeah.|But if I'm going to follow your orders, I need to know...|Who are your sources?|And why don't you fight with us?
Trust me.|In a few weeks, you'll understand the reason for my secrecy.|I can't have word getting out, no matter what.

I know how it feels to lose everything to the Empire.|Even now, the memories still burn a hole in my gut.|So I know what you're going through...|But if you can trust me, I promise we will have our revenge.
Don't let it be said that I've never given you anything.|Since you're here...
A gift from... my sources.|Take it or leave it, I don't care.|Perhaps you'll find a better use for it than I have.

name: Strength
commands: What do you want?|Come to gloat?|Feel free... Not like I could stop you anyhow...
I get it. I've been replaced...|With you all here, Sam will never need my help.|I really am weak.
You're not weak!|I was just worried...
I've seen you out here training.|Every day, for hours. You never let up.
What happened between you and Sam?|Why won't he let you fight?

...If it'll get you off my back.{w}{clear}On one of the Resistance's first missions, I made a mistake.|A nearly fatal mistake.|Sam tried his best to heal me,|but there was nothing more he could do.|No more missions after that.
I'm still weak.|I thought that maybe one day...|But then, you all showed up.|Now I'll never have a chance to prove myself.
Of course.|Let me get back to training.
I think you've done enough training for today.|Come on.
Well, don't you want to put that training to use?|Let's go catch up to the others.
B-But... Sam told me not to go...

I may not have been here long,|but I've come to realize that Sam has his own weakness.|He is afraid to lose you.|But he doesn't know how strong you are now.|And he'll never know if you don't show him that you aren't weak anymore.
Just a simple good luck charm.|Now let's go. They're probably halfway to Rajas by now.

name: Theo Sphinx, Pt. I
commands: Listen... It started like this.|It was an uneventful Tuesday morning.|I should have known something was up.|My hangover from last night was gnashing my temples,|like a toothless rat on a nickel steak.|I needed another drink.|Or five.{w}{clear}That's when trouble walked in the door.
A blue-haired dame, looking more nervous than a spinal column.|She was an old flame of mine who'd fallen on hard times.|But I wasn't looking to rekindle the relationship.
Theo, what are you mumbling about?|Are you alright?|Anyways, I've lost a tome of mine...|Have you seen it around by chance?
This had bad news written on it like the front page of the morning paper.|But Theo Sphinx, Private Eye never refuses a case,|no matter how dangerous.
I agreed, reluctantly--|for the sake of the past.
Oh you don't have to go through the trouble, I was just wondering if...

The dame prattled on, but I'd heard enough.|I dusted off my jacket, lit up my last cigar, grabbed my hat and walked out,|the scent of one too many cheap drinks hanging on the wallpaper.|I had a meeting with destiny, and she was a cold mistress.

name: Sam Arrive
commands: # Change Sam and Kayla to player controlled
Ophie dies OR Sam dies,Party size falls below 5. Currently {eval:len(game.get_units_in_party())}
Looks like we're not too late...
I'd certainly hope not... dragging me out here on such short notice.|There'd better be something to see.
Look! They're making their way up the switchbacks.
Oh, how romantic!|Our heroes dashing through the sweltering desert, bandits on their tail.|It's just like a novel!
We're not here to discuss literature, Kayla.
Tsk Tsk. A lady needs time to prepare, you know.|But if you're in such a rush...|Men, into formation! Spread out and take the ridge!

name: Infinite
commands: # Summon three bandits from the topleft
# Summon three bandits from the bottom

name: Infinite
commands: # Summon two knights from the left
# Summon two knights from the right
# Summon two mages from the left
# Summon two mages from the right

name: Infinite
commands: # Summon six knights from the topright

name: Infinite2
commands: # Summon four dracoknights from the topleft
# Summon four dracoknights from the bottomright

name: Armory
commands: Mithril Sword,Adamant Sword,Mithril Lance,Adamant Lance,Javelin,Mithril Axe,Adamant Axe,Hand Axe,Yew Bow,Longbow,Shine,Mend,Flux

name: Armory
commands: Rapier,Mithril Sword,Adamant Sword,Mithril Lance,Adamant Lance,Short Spear,Mithril Axe,Adamant Axe,Short Axe,Yew Bow,Longbow

name: Village
commands: This house has been long abandoned to the spreading sands...|But what's this?

name: Outro
commands: # Change Sam and Kayla to player controlled
Sir, I don't know how we can ever repay you.
No need.|Besides, it is not me you should be thanking.
Without my friend's stubborn insistence on doing what is right,|we never would have succeeded.|He led the charge.
Thank you.|Finding and returning our children...|It's like a miracle from out of the age of the Moon King.
All in a days' work for the Resistance.|We Keralans have to stick together.
Indeed.|Thank you again, all of you, for your help.
So, I guess I should thank you.|You arrived in the nick of time.
No, actually I should apologize to you.|You were right.|We can't hide in the shadows and expect to accomplish anything substantial.
Well, I'm glad you came around.
Who's this...?|Sammy, my dear, you still haven't told them about me?|Trying to keep me all to yourself? Tsk Tsk.|It's a pleasure to meet you, Ophie.|I'm Kayla.
This woman is your secret source?
...Kayla is a liason from the Confederacy of Free Cities.
The Confederacy is a group of free city states to the east.|They've banded together to protect themselves against the Empire's ambition.
Indeed. I'm with the Confederacy's... diplomacy bureau.

She's one of the reasons the Resistance has had such success lately.|There are many Confederacy spies in the ranks of the Empire.|They relay back important information about where the Empire is weak,|and when would be a good time to strike.
So you're Sam's mysterious source.|This is who you've been trusting, Sam?{w}{clear}Kayla, your 'information' nearly got us killed at Fort Kosheen.
Ah yes, one of our spies fed us false information.|Tsk Tsk.|Don't worry, he was dealt with.|Harshly.

There's no need to be suspicious.|Any enemy of the Empire is a friend of ours.|The Confederacy's been struggling against the Empire for many solstices.|They're interested in Kerala's freedom just as much as we are.

Lately, the Confederacy's decided to take a more active approach.|I'll be accompanying you all on your missions from now on.|How exciting!|You should know I've never really done anything so hands-on before.|Freedom fighters, nighttime raids, disguised princesses...|Oh, how romantic!
Yeah, we'll see how you like it after the next mission, eh?
Oh, don't be rude.|I didn't get this far on my looks alone now.
Kayla's one of the Confederacy's top shamans.|She can take care of herself.
Well, no use dilly-dallying.|I want to see what accoutrements you've managed to scrounge up.
You never brought her to the base, Sam?
So what does your base look like?
Do you all live in a big treehouse?
Or maybe in the sewers, with, like, rat throw-rugs?|Or I know, behind a waterfall!|That's gotta be it...

name: Intro
commands: # Everyone except Sam heads out in a rush.
Welcome back, everyone.|The last mission went better than expected, so congratulations.|In thanks for a job well done, I'm giving you all a day off.
Don't go expecting this to happen often, now--
If the Empire's discovered our location...|We need to leave right away...|I wasn't expecting them to be able to track this--
So you say you're no spy...|Why are you here then?
I was just trying to speak to you.|We need your help!
I'm from Podoma.|Your group defended our village.
Because of the drought, our last harvest was poor.|W-we couldn't pay the Empire's absurd taxes.|So they sent one of their warlocks...
He took the only thing we had left...|our children...|Please, you have to help us!|I can't bear to lose my son!
Even for the Empire, stealing children seems excessive.
It must be Vagnius's idea!|That bastard!|Where did he take them?
H-he said he was taking them to the Sun temple's ruins...
A likely story...|They must be trying to draw us out.|Well, we won't give them the satisfaction.|Sorry, but we're not just going to walk right into their trap.
How can you be so heartless?
I'm just being rational.|Let's take some time and think this through.|We'll find a plan that doesn't require blindly walking into Vagnius's trap.
We can't just sit here and do nothing!|We're the Resistance, and we do what's right!
Sorry, captain, but the lad's right...|If we can't stop Imperials from snatching children out from under our noses,|we don't deserve to be called the Resistance.
Harrumph...|It's your life to throw away...
I reckon' we don't got time to dawdle.|Let's go while the trail's fresh!
You don't have to worry, boss.|Those posers won't be getting through the Ghat Mountain Bandits.|You can trust me on that!|They don't call us the toughest bandits this side of the Ghats for no reason!
Uh-huh.|I hope your boys can live up to such a... glorious... reputation.

Those children are safe with us!|...Well, not really safe, since they've been kidnapped...|Which does not meet the normal criteria for safety.|But I assure you, they will not be leaving this temple.|The Ghat Mountain bandits are in their natural element!
Hee hee! More gold.|What's this for, boss?
Holding children hostage isn't exactly lauded by the international community...
Oh, I get ya, boss.|Not a word of it will pass my lips!
Hey! Where you going, boss?|Don't you want to see the fireworks?
I have more important things to do than watch a slaughter.|I trust you can handle those nuisances when they show, or it'll be your skin.
Could we have lost them?|A-are we... too late?
No, they must be nearby.|There's an old temple over there.|Maybe Vagnius is hiding within, like the snake he is...
Well, well, well...|Look who decided to show up, boys!|You know, you're late!|And I hate being kept waiting!
You bet we were, sweet cheeks!
Where are the children?|We know Vagnius brought them here!
Ha ha ha! Don't get ahead of yourself, boy!|If you want those children, you'll have to go through us.|The Ghat Mountain Bandits!|The toughest bandits this side of the Ghat Mountains!|Ha ha ha!
Come on. There's no time to waste!
# There was movement, so reset that

name: Theo Sphinx, Pt. II
commands: It was what folks called the dead of winter.|The dirt mixed with the snow until the alleys were plastered in a gritty brown.|A fine complement to this cold case.|I'd just stopped off at Joel's and ordered a good hot cup o' joe,|when in comes a violet-haired vixen with an eerie smile--|looking for me, as usual.
Rumor is you wanted to talk to me, Theo?|What's up?

I had little to go on, but this dame was my first lead.|She might have looked enticing, but every rose has its thorns.|Stolen many a bloke's heart--|along with his money.|She'd supposedly reformed, but I had my doubts.|I asked her if she'd been around O'Halley's street anytime lately.|Maybe the temptation of her past had proven too great?
What are you going on about, Theo?|O'Halley Street?
She tried to play dumb with me, but I wasn't buying it.|I'd seen her at Miss Prim's weekend galas,|often through the glass of a strong scotch.
Oh, Prim's room? Yeah, I've been by...|I heard she lost a tome?
Finally a lead.|I pressed her on her story.

Hey, you think I took it?|Sure, I'm a thief, but I don't steal from the Resistance!|You've got to know that by now, Theo.|Trust me, I'm not the culprit.|Maybe Sam knows?|He's always keeping tabs on us.

She made like a skydiver with a broken parachute and hit the road,|leaving me to my thoughts.|This case was a real stumper.|But I knew who to turn to next,|an old friend on the force who might have some answers...

name: Apologies
commands: Insubordination.|Disobedience.|Refusal to follow my direct orders.
I'm not finished.{w}{clear}Do you know what you've done?|I could expect this from Ophie or Prim, but from you?|One misstep, one false move, and it's over for us.
No need. I understand plenty.|And I'm sorry.
You should never have been on that mission.|You were too inexperienced, and you suffered for it.{w}{clear}But I've come to realize that you've changed.
You're much stronger now. I was wrong to keep you caged here.|I hope you can forgive my poor judgement.
...All this time, I thought you hated me... for my failure.
Of course not!|You were my responsiblity.|But you can handle yourself now, right?
Then, welcome back to the team, Eliza.
But as a member of the Resistance...|no more insubordination, got that?|I must be confident my orders will be followed.
I was saving this for your return.|I expected it to be a couple more solstices, but...
You won't regret this, Sam. Thank you.

name: Joel and Nia
commands: Howdy, Nia! You're up early.|The sun's barely peaked o'er the horizon.|Oh! And you already caught something? Rabbit, is it?
A few more years and I'll have you gossiping like a real high society gal.|Just you wait.
Aaah.....|Nothing like fresh breakfast at the crack of dawn...

You know, Nia, the winds are changin' mighty quick round here.|Our little resistance has grown leaps and bounds jus' in the past moon.|I reckon something fierce is brewin' in ol' Sam's mind.|A plan to end this struggle, one way or another...

So what I mean to say is that these peaceful moments...|they're gonna be few and far between.{w}{clear}Ah, hell, Nia. I just want ya to know that I might not be around as much.|I know you survived alone before, but you ARE human.|You could use a friend.{w}{clear}If I don't make it, Nia... try to at least talk to someone every once in a while, okay?
...Well, I'm glad we could talk.|But I suppose we've got to get ready for the day.|So long.

name: Switch
commands: We've done it! Everyone, forward, across the chasm!
They've lowered the gates...|Seems I've underestimated this Resistance...
I know.|Spare me tales of your incompetence.|We'll handle them on our terms, then.|Cut them off on the bridges.
Perhaps my blade will taste new blood under this moon...

name: DoorSW
commands: Thanks, gal.|It's not everyday I'm rescued by such a beauty!
Quit mooning, Jeb.|Let's get out of here while we still can.
If you get out of here in one piece, hit me up!
Thanks man.|You make sure you get that warden for us, eh?

name: DoorSouth
commands: Heh! Looks like you were right, mate.
Hey, Coyote!{w} Boy!|Where are you going?|Don't you want to escape?
...Shiver me timbers, that boy's got something biting him.

name: Turn1
commands: # Coyote and Kiley discuss breaking out...
Boy, what you getting all antsy for?
Psshaw... Just another escapee.|His day isn't going to end well... the warden'll make sure of that.
So calm down, mate.|You're raising my cackles.|Anyway, if something is happening, I'm sure we'll know about it soon.

Damn! We've been spotted.|Okay, everyone, get a hold of yourself.|We need to get across that chasm.|There should be switches around here that open the gates.|We need to pull them or we're never getting across.

name: Turn2
commands: What is going on, private?|Why hasn't the escapee been brought to me?
I should hope not!|No one has ever escaped from Tyrana Prison under my watch.|I do not intend to break that tradition today, private.
Ma'am, uh... we're under attack.|From the Resistance.
So? Wipe them out like all the others!|No-one escapes, do you hear me?|Or it'll be your skin!
Fools, all of them.|There will be some... replacements after today's debacle.
Ah, it's just another alarm.|Can't a man get any sleep in this hellhole!
Nah. I bet it's the Resistance!|They're gonna break us out...
Not once they see my record.
We'd better prepare anyway.|Grab your weapon.|Now's our chance to make our escape.|I'm getting out of here tonight if I can help it, Resistance be damned.
We'll see how well they do against the warden...

name: LineCross1
condition: any(unit.position[1] < 13 for unit in game.units if unit.position and unit.team == 'player')

name: Intro
commands: # Make sure we set this to something that can't be reached
Good morning...|I trust everyone had a good night's sleep?
Just wandering in Kayla?|Welcome to the land of the living.
Ah, buzz off, Sam.|You all live in a cave!|A dank, smelly, cave!|How's a lady supposed to get her beauty sleep with these...{w}these...|horrid accoutrements!
Alright, we've all heard your gripes.|If everyone would settle down, we could get down to business.|Our next mission is our most important one yet.
Don't you say that everytime, Sam?

Hmmm... Do I?|Well, anyway, this time I mean it.|The Resistance has so far achieved success through stealth.|However, we're never going to drive the Empire out with mere subterfuge.|We need to be able to match the Empire's might on the battlefield.
But how... They have an army...
That's why we're getting an army of our own.
I like where this is going.
Kayla, your Confederacy of Free States will help?|They have an army, right?
Pah... We'd just be trading one empire for another.
No... the Confederacy wants to remain hands off for now.
Then where do you intend to find an army?
I'm sure everyone here has heard of Tyrana Prison.
Monks don't get out much, do they?{w}{clear}Anyway, Tyrana Prison is a brutal work camp.|Political prisoners and other dissidents are forced to labor in the mines.
We're going to break those prisoners out.|They'll form the backbone of our revolutionary army.
It sure is... ambitious, Captain.|Do ya reckon' we can pull it off?
We don't have a choice. Subterfuge can only get us so far.|We need to raise an army, and these prisoners are our best bet.|They hate the Empire as much as we do.
Do we have any more info?|I don't want to go in blind.
The Confederacy has been watching the area.|There's a secret passage that leads straight into the prison's heart.|Once there, we do what we can to foment a prison riot.
If there are no more questions, then everyone gear up.|We're going straight into the heart of Imperial territory...
At least it'll be warmer inside. I'm f-freezing!

Before we make our way in, a heads-up.|The Confederacy has a man on the inside, posing as a prisoner.|He goes by the code name 'Coyote'.|But we lost contact with him.|They must've have tightened up security.|Honestly, he's probably dead.
But if he's still around, he could be a valuable resource.
We'll keep that in mind.{w}{clear}Our objective is to incapacitate the warden.|If we can take out their chain of command, the rest of the prison should follow.
Okay, everyone, hush!|We're nearing the passage. I'll take it from here.
Well, we haven't been caught yet...
Of course we haven't! I'm really good at this kind of thing.
Ah, perfect.|We made it, everyone.|No need for congratulations, tips are fine--
No time for questions, Sam!|We've been spotted!

name: Theo Sphinx, Pt. III
commands: It was raining.|Hard, drumming, pounding rain.|The kind of rain you'd hope would clean the filth right off the streets.|Sam "Snake Eyes" Alhara was waiting outside the station.|Well, not all our wishes can come true.
What is it Theo?|I'm kind of busy here...|Our next raid is quite important.
Sam was a cool customer, with a face made for radio.|An old partner of mine, but we'd drifted apart since I left the force.|Too bad he was my only lead on this one.
Prim's missing tome?|Really, Theo?|Don't you think this could wait?
I could tell he was hiding something.|Sam's the kind of guy who'd jump at the chance to prove himself to the force.|Kissing the commissioner's ass was half his job description these days.
Well, maybe the Empire's managed to infiltrate us after all?|This isn't good...
You'd have figured Sam would've had some smarts,|since he surely hadn't graduated the academy on his looks.
This is not the way the Empire would've done it.|It was somebody on the inside, Sam!
But, who would've taken Prim's tome...|Did you talk to Renae?|Or you could try Nia, she's perceptive, if you can get her to talk.|Anyway, I've got work to do...

Clearly, Sam was not going to be any more help.|He didn't know a thing--|no surprise.|After I roughed him up a bit, he made like a rat on a sinking ship and bailed.|But I had one more lead, and I was going to make it count.

name: Guard Duty
commands: Huh? Miss, are you addressing me?
You bet! Mister red-haired stranger man--
You can't come in unless you know the password.
This is the Resistance base, y'know, and we can't have just anybody walk in!|That's why Sam entrusted me with guarding the entrance!
But... I don't know the password.
Then, Hank, you're out of luck!|Come back another day!
I swear on my knightly honor that I am a full-fledged member of the Resistance.
You sure about that, Nate?|'Cause I think I would recognize a member of the Resistance.
It's Drake, and also I'm quite sure.|Don't you remember when we attacked Fort Kosheen?|I held off those guards.
I was also present when we disrupted that Imperial weapon shipment.
You're wasting my time, Frank.|I think I would remember some tough looking red-haired dude, don't you?|You're not exactly easy to miss.
Urgh! I don't have the patience for this.|Just... go retrieve Sam or Althea!|They'll vouch for me.
Woah, now.|Don't get all bent out of shape, Drew.|I finally figured it all out!
Now you're just confusing me, Mike.|Are you Althea's boyfriend or not?
No. I mean... Urgh!|I am Althea's pledged guardian!|But we're not in a romantic relationship!
So, its more of a friends with benefits thing? I like it!
Urgh!!!|Please. No more, Renae.|I can't handle it. Just let me in.
Heehee! I'm just pulling your leg, Pate.
What? This was all a practical joke?
Yep!|Like Sam would ever assign ME guard duty!|He'd have to be out of his mind!|Hahaha!

name: Cipher
commands: Done packing?|Dear, I haven't even started.
What! But we're leaving in less than an hour!
Tsk Tsk. Don't you worry, Sam.|I'll be ready.|Here, sit down with me.|Maybe you can help me decipher this tome?
...|Hmmm... You sure this is even magical?|I don't recognize any of these words...
I'm certain. Can't you sense the aura?
You know I've no talent for that.|Anyway, I think I do recognize some of this script.|Here. Move over.
This section is total gibberish, but this right here.|It almost looks like a legend or guide.
Take a look at this pattern.|This symbol shows up all over the place.
Hmmm... Maybe its the key?|It shows up on page two, three, five, seven, eleven...|...|Primes!
Try it.|Read only the prime characters on the page.
It is a spell! And powerful too!{w}{clear}Oh, thank you, Sam! I knew I could count on you!
Also, hurry up!|We don't have all day!
Ah... Seems I let the time get ahead of me.
Tsk Tsk. Time enjoyed is never time wasted.|Thanks for your help, dearest.
No problem.|It's not everyday someone shares my fascination with the magical arts...
And it's not everyday a spell's cipher is solved that quickly, handsome.|Now be on your way.|A lady needs time to prepare.

name: Outro
commands: # Main Prison Leader is Kiley. Speaks like a pirate
# Coyote is recruited if not already
Thanks for agreeing to meet with us.
Heh! Your crew certainly got the warden good.|Least I could do is show my proper 'preciation.
Could've stuck around for the fight...
But now that you've me and my boys, what would you have us do?
I ain't normally one for 'rithmetic, but if I had to take a gander...|Maybe four or five hundred.
So, I would guess you don't harbor any love for the Empire?
Uh... Well we can't induct all of your...{w}crew into the Resistance.|You're too many.
But with this many at our back,|the Resistance could finally fight toe to toe with Duke Ulver's army.
Hmmph! Me and my boys ain't exactly subtle, y'know.
Well, the Confederacy has prepared a hiding place for such an eventuality.|We can keep your crew hidden.|You'll be a reserve for when the Resistance needs the firepower.
Kiley, if you agree,|you'll be in charge of the Revolutionary Army of Kerala.|A force to fight the Empire when and where it is needed most.

Aye...|Commander of an army....|Sounds like a lot of responsibilities...{w}{clear}But, if me country needs me, what can I say?|Plus me boys wouldn't know what to do without me.|Joinin' the military might do 'em some good.
Coyote, you'll be coming with us.
Awww. I didn't know you two were so close!|But seriously, Coyote is a special agent for the Confederacy.
Coyote, you never told me yer were a spook.
Don't worry, you'll see him soon.|He'll be our liason.
Aye. Well, if everythings all figured out, it's as cold as a witch's tit up here.|Where's this hiding spot of yours, girly?

name: Turn3
condition: game.turncount == 3 or any(unit.position[0] - unit.position[1] < 15 for unit in game.units if unit.team == 'player' and unit.position)
commands: Sir, the Resistance is attacking!|What are your orders?
So this assignment wasn't a complete waste of time.|Hold the line for now.|My glorius plan will deal with these interlopers in due time.
Hah, hah, hah!|Those fools don't know what they are walking into.|My plan is unassailable!

name: Turn8
condition: game.turncount == 8 or any(unit.position[0] - unit.position[1] < 5 for unit in game.units if unit.team == 'player' and unit.position)
commands: Sir, the Resistance has advanced further into our territory.|What do we do now?
This so-called Resistance. I did not give them enough credit.|But no matter,|the next phase of my master plan will wipe them out once and for all!|Send in... Team Omega!
Uh... must you....|Just...|Just send in those bandits we hired.
He really sucks all the dramatic tension out of the moment.|I'd fire him, I really would.|But its so hard to find good help these days...

name: Turn14
condition: game.turncount == 14 or any(unit.position[0] - unit.position[1] < -8 for unit in game.units if unit.team == 'player' and unit.position)
commands: Sir! The bandits were not enough!|The Resistance is nearing us!|What do we do, sir?
Hahaha!|Do not worry!|This is all part of my master plan.
One must draw in the Resistance to truly destroy them,|like a fish to a line.
A pleasant side-effect.|The Resistance will be destroyed, and the bandit menace will be curtailed!|My plan is impregnable!|Activate the final phase of my plan!
In one fell swoop, the Resistance will be defeated,|and I will garner the credit I so rightfully deserve!

name: Intro
commands: We've received some spoils from our last mission.
So then...|Our last few missions have been quite... challenging.
Hopefully this next one will be easier.
Especially with Coyote and Kayla in our roster.
We know who your sources are, Sam.|She's standing right here.
Tsk tsk. No need to ruin Sam's fun, Ophie.|You know playing at spymaster is the only thing he has left--
Ahem.|As I was saying, my sources, that is, the Confederacy,|determined the location of Duke Ulver's upcoming military plans.|Details of Imperial logistics would be an invaluable asset.
Why can't the Confederacy do their own work for once?|We didn't ask to be at their beck and call.
Well, this information has value for both parties.{w}{clear}Plus, the Confederacy has been so far unsuccessful using stealth.|So... we're going to capture the plans by force!
We believe they are currently at Fort Bekal, which is nearby.|We'll leave after breakfast.|Hopefully the plans will be in hand by lunch.
Now that's my kind of mission!
Hmmm.... There's a lot of them.|Duke Ulver has this place locked down.
See that black banner flying above the fort?
Tsk Tsk.|It's the flag of the elite Imperial tacticians.|This wasn't in the report. We'd better be on our guard.
Strange to see someone of that caliber posted to simple guard duty.
All the more reason to get that information.
I just hope its worth the effort.
Oh, it will be. Trust me.
Of course, milord. My plans have never failed!|Once the Resistance attacks, well, they're surely going to regret it!
Good, good. I want them wiped out.|No captives. No survivors.
It's all been factored into the plan.|Which is flawless, by the way.|As long as they show up, of course.
Oh, they'll show alright.|We have a mole in the Confederacy.|We fed them false information that this fort was basically unguarded.
Ah, but of course, it's not poorly guarded at all!|Genius, milord. I couldn't have come up with a better plan myself.
Perhaps that is why they kicked you out here to the colonies.
Nothing, nothing.|I'll trust you to see this through.
How dare he, insult my genius...|I'll show him.|I'll kill two Resistances!|See how he likes that!|Yeah...
Okay everyone, we need to hit this fort hard and fast.|We can't give their tactician any time to react and formulate a plan.

name: Village1
commands: Honey grab the kids!|The Empire has come for us!
There's more what that came from!|Now, get out of my house!

name: Village2
commands: What are you doing at my door, you whippersnappers!|Do you expect these old bones to fight?|Here, take this and get off my lawn!

name: Village3
commands: Are you defending the village?|Here, take this.|When the Imperial army passed through here, I managed to snatch it.|It should serve you well.

name: Village4
commands: I was a soldier once.|I even fought during the Second Rebellion--|A brutal, short affair that was. {w}Now?|I'm just a simple merchant.|Don't have much use for this old hunk of metal any more.

name: Village6
commands: My husband was an archer.|He fought off bandits with his trusty bow.|B-but he perished in the fight with the Rusonoon army...|Take this.|If using his bow helps you save someone you love, I'm sure he'd be proud.

name: Village5
commands: Mother says that I should hide in the basement whenever bandits attack,|but I want to fight too.{w}{clear}One day, I'll grow big and strong and be able to fight the Empire!|Just like my pa and my big brother.|I'll go all over Kerala, killing Imperials wherever they lurk. Yaaah!
Yes, mother!|Here, you can have this.

name: Outro
commands: I sure hope this information is worth the effort, Sam.
I guess we'll find out.|I'll head inside the fort and see what I can find.|Take a breather. You've earned it.
You know a lot about the Empire.
Uh... well... I don't know if that's true.|There's always more to learn.
Well, do you know who that man was?

He definitely didn't seem like one of the Duke's normal lieutenants.|That ward he used signified that much.|I would guess he was sent here on the Empress's orders.|Whatever's in this information must be important...
It wasn't as easy to find as I'd been led to believe.|Anyway, we've got what we came for. Let's go.
Keeping ME waiting... He will pay for this insult.
The Duke will see you now. Follow me.
How noble of you to grace me with your--
Vagnius.|Spare me your ingratiations.|What of the Resistance?
Marduk... has failed, milord.|The Resistance lives.
But we were close this time, milord. So very, very close!|Give me one more chance.
Hmmm... Second chances are not the Imperial way.|Nor a taste for failure.
The village of Podoma, milord.|The Resistance will not ignore the feverish pleas of their own countrymen.|I can draw them into the open and eliminate them once and for all.
Proceed with your plan, Vagnius.|This is your last chance.
Thank you, milord.|Your magninimony is overwhelming--
Milord, is it wise to let him depart?|He covets your position.
Ha! Let the weasel plot.|He has not the strength nor fortitude to challenge me.|But, if he were to succeed, then it must be so.
''To the strongest.''|Is this not the way of the Empire, Adjutant?
Then we have nothing to worry about.

name: Turn1
commands: Ah, so the Resistance has finally shown their faces.|After them! I want them strung up!{w}{br}All will see the fate of those who oppose me!

name: Turn4
commands: Bah! What is taking so long? Put them down!
The reinforcements are on their way, milord.
I want them here, now!|The Resistance will not slip away from me, on the eve of my victory

name: Intro
commands: Gather round everyone.|I have an important announcement to make...
I hope everyone had a restful sleep, because it may be your last for a while.

Kayla, Theo, and I have spent the last few days decrypting the Empire's code...|Now, getting the information out from that tome was not easy.|All the data was encrypted with a...|Well, it doesn't actually matter.{w}{clear}What does matter is... well...|Let's just say our timetable's been moved up.
For putting you on the throne.
No more beating around the bush, Sam.|What did you discover?
That tome held a trove of information.|It's no wonder the Empire went to such lengths to protect it.|Kayla, why don't you explain it?

My pleasure, Sam.|The Confederacy has reinforced their northern front.|We were hoping to force the Empire to commit some of their armies there.|However, we didn't expect the Empire to react so strongly.
They're going to attack the Confederacy directly!?
Tsk Tsk. Even the Empire would not be so bold.|However, the Empress has commandeered nearly four-fifths of Duke Ulver's army.|They are off to reinforce that front.
So that leaves Duke Ulver's force in Rajas...
However, another army from the Imperial heartlands will reinforce Ulver soon.
We only have three days before the new army arrives.
Simply put, we finish this.|We take back Kerala.|We put the rightful heir back on the Lion Throne.

With the Imperial army weakened, we can attack Rajas directly.|Kiley's army, along with a host of loyalists, will assault the front gates.|In the meantime, we will sneak into the Sun Palace and capture or kill the Duke,|cutting the Imperial head off the proverbial snake.|With their leader deposed, the remaining Imperials should be easily routed.
Then Althea can take the throne.|Kerala will be free from foreign rule.

And we'll have the Confederacy's support.|We'll announce Althea's presence after our victory.|She looks just like her mother, so no accusations of a pretender are likely.|The Empire will be unlikely to challenge us after the Confederacy's moves,|and we'll have the support of all of Kerala.
That's an ambitious plan...|Ya reckon we can pull it off?
Another opportunity like this may not come again...|Is everyone prepared to do this?
Anything that will help the Keralan people.
I didn't tag along with you lot this long just to drop out now...
Tsk Tsk, Sam. Anything for you, dearest.|Plus, if we succeed here, I'll get a fantastic promotion!
No, no...|We should restore Kerala's independance!
It would be my honor to return Althea to her rightful station as queen.
Perfect. Then we're all in agreement.|Coyote has already been sent to tell Kiley the news...
What are we waiting for!|We need to prepare!
Right. Everyone, this meeting is adjourned.|Get ready. We strike at dawn tomorrow.
# A villager arrives, telling that they're under attack. Everyone get ready.
You again?|We can't afford any security breaches at a time like this!|If the Empire raids us now...
Please! You have to help us!
Podoma is under attack.|It's that man from before.|And this time he brought an army!
Our entire village will be destroyed...|You're our only hope...
Uh...|Yes. Of course.|Okay, Ophie, get everyone together.|We need to book it to Podoma, before Vagnius digs in.
Oh thank you so much.|I don't know how we can repay you.
Don't worry about that now.|Head back to Podoma, and tell everyone to stay indoors.|I don't want additional casualties on our hands.|We'll be there as soon as we can...
Of course... more complications.|Why can't anything just go according to plan for once...
No, milord.|Surprisingly, we've encountered little resistance at all.
They must know I'm here by now.|What could be taking them...

If you want something done right, you have to do it yourself.|My underlings have failed to annihilate the pesky Resistance.|But I shall not.|By the end of today, they will be no more.|And I will be one step closer to my final goal!
Well the town's still standing.|We're not too late.
Master Yohn, you have not been forgotten.|Vagnius dies today, this I swear.

name: Midnight Rendezvous
commands: # Coyote and Sam discuss passage into Rajas
... Coyote?|Uh... what a... um... pleasant surprise.{w}{clear}You do know it's two in the morning?
Rumor has it you're planning to assault Rajas.
Hmmm... It's a complicated problem.|Ulver has at least five hundred men stationed--{w}{clear}Wait. Back up. How'd did you find out?
It doesn't matter.{w}{clear}Are you aware of the Order of the Templars?
Of course I'm aware.|What do you take me for?|I've looked into them myself, but they're a myth, nothing more.

Pah...|The Templars were said to be the Solarch's most loyal protectors.|They were to defend the throne with their lives.|To snuff out dissent, they could appear anywhere in Rajas, at any time...|...|Are you suggesting--
...*sigh*|If we can find one of these tunnels...
I was never here. Got that?
...There is something very wrong with that man...

name: Coronation
commands: Hey... Althea? Can I come in?
I noticed you were... hesitant at the meeting today.|Is something wrong?
You know, Althea, you can talk to me.|I won't tell anyone else if something's bothering you.
...Do you not want to be queen?
It's... It's not that I don't want to...|Ah... I j-just can't...
What? Why couldn't you?|You're the spitting image of your mother--

It's not that I can't be queen...|I just won't be able to.|I have no experience...|My sister was the expected heir to the throne.|She was the one everyone looked up to...|She was so strong. I am but a shadow in comparison...
It does! I'm... I'm too weak.|Everyone will be relying on me.|What if I fail? I-It's too much!
There there.|Slow down... you'll make yourself hysterical.
See I'm just weak...|I have nothing of the royal strength in me.

That's untrue, Althea. You do have the makings of a queen.|I may not know much about politics or government,|but I have a knack for knowing a good person when I see one.|And I know that you do not lack strength.
I believe in you.|Also, there's something else you haven't thought of.
You won't be taking on the responsibility of the throne alone.|Do you think we'll just abandon you?|Our job will not be over when Kerala is freed.
My lady Althea... Your conduct at the meeting was concerning--|Wait, you've been crying?{w}{clear}I would not normally strike a lady, Prim, but you leave me no choice--
Yes, I've been crying, but it's nothing to be concerned with.|Prim and I were just talking. She was very helpful.
Oh, is that all.|My poor heart...
There's nothing to be worried about, Drake.|I'll be queen.|Well, I'll try my best at it.|You'll be there for me, right?
Of course, my lady...|If you so wished it I would never leave your side!
See, Althea. You won't have to shoulder this burden alone.|Although you may wish you had after a couple of weeks.

name: Outro
commands: # Remaining Soldiers Flee on Vagnius's death.
The rest have turned tail and run.
Good riddance.|I guess we can consider this another victory then.
Tsk tsk. You sound so down.|This was a victory!
There's still so much to do, and so little time.
If we succeed, by tomorrow evening Althea will be on the throne,|Duke Ulver will have been defeated, and Kerala will be free.
And the Resistance... it will be no more.
Ah... feeling wistful already Sam?|This was the Resistance's purpose, was it not?|It can't last forever. It shouldn't.
I know.|This chapter will end, and a new chapter of our lives will begin.
A better one. For all the people of Kerala.
Prim, aren't you supposed to be with Althea?

She's got Drake to take care of her.|Besides she's doing great.|You should see how she handles herself around the townsfolk.|Even though she's just a girl, really...|she definitely has the makings of a queen.
What's wrong? You can talk to me.
I-I thought Vagnius was some... incarnation of pure evil,|like a devil out of a storybook.|But really he was just an ordinary man.|Twisted, sure.|But he died just the same as the rest...
So... do you feel any better?|Now that he's gone.
Kind of?|...I wish Master Yohn were here...{w}{clear}I just keep looking for him...|I miss him.
For now, we rest.|Tomorrow is the final act.|If we succeed, our long quest will finally be over.|The Empire defeated.|Althea on the throne.|Kerala finally free.
It all comes down to tomorrow, then.
It all comes down to tomorrow.

name: BridgeSwapConvo
commands: Well, that did something alright.|Is this what they meant by a game?

name: Promises
commands: Tsk Tsk. A lady is ready precisely when she means to be, and no sooner.
No... Well, its nothing you said.
To be honest, I am a bit worried. Even you have your limits, Kayla.

Anyways, thats not really my chief concern.|It's our last mission together.|When this is over we'll split ways.|The Resistance will be disbanded.|So, there won't be much of a reason... for the two of us.
Sam, say no more. You know my feelings toward you.|Do you think I'll just leave?
No, but we each have jobs, responsibilities, ambitions.|Those too can strand us apart.|I don't want to look back on today with any regrets.
Well, then,|after this is over... if we're both still...|around.|I'd like to make this fling official.
I'd been meaning to give it to you for a while...|but I could never find the right time.|So...
You thought I'd turn you down?
Never hurts to consider the possibilities.
...You know we're not going to die out there.
Between the two of us, Sam, nothing can stand in our way.

name: Theo and Eliza
commands: Would you HURRY up already, Theo?|You've been at this for hours!|What more could you need to bring?!
One moment, please. I need some time to consider...
We're not gonna need all this!|This is just a day trip, Theo!
What could you possibly need all these potions for?
Always important to keep your weapons in tip-top shape.
We're not traveling by sea, Theo!
One can never be too prepared.
I never leave home bereft of a good read.
Pah! You and your books.|If Ophie's right about one thing, it's that they're no substitute for reality!
Hmm... Ironic, coming from you, Eliza.
I've seen you engrossed in one.
You have?|I mean... no you haven't!
Hmmm... Let's take a look then, shall we.|Ahem.{w}{clear}''The crow has flown away--|Swaying in the evening sun,|A leafless tree.''
It's quite good.|I had no idea you were a poet, Eliza.
My... uh... where'd you find that.
I picked it up by accident.|But really, Eliza, you write poetry?
I think it's quite good, quite good indeed.
Don't you dare tell anyone else, you got that Theo!|Or it'll be your head!

name: Theo Sphinx, Pt. IV
commands: Snow.|Since when did it snow around here?|And it was coming down in buckets.{w}{clear}So this was it, my last lead in this godforsaken case.|The hour crawled by like a sick cockroach.|I'd almost given up hope when out of the dark strutted a raven-haired dame.|She had a wild glint in her eyes.|Before she could scamper off, I cornered her.

She looked tenser than a minister in a brothel.|I asked her if she'd heard anything about Miss Prim's problem.|She shook her head, but I wasn't having it.|I grabbed her by the collar and demanded the truth about the missing tome--|I've still got the scratches to prove it.|To my surprise, her expression softened.|She beckoned me down 79th street and I followed.|After what seemed like a dozen twists and turns through this concrete jungle,|we arrived at a run-down shack on the outskirts of the East Side.

Nia didn't mince words.|But I could tell something was going to be finished once I walked in that door--|either this case, or me.|The dame made like a banana and split,|while I holstered my gun and made my way inside.{w}{clear}I was ready for answers.
Tsk Tsk. So you've finally arrived, Theo.|I was wondering if you'd ever manage to track me down.|How'd you find the place?
The silver-haired dame was all business.
No, don't tell me.|That damned girl!
Your game is up, Kayla.|Hand over the tome.
Sad to see such a pretty girl turning herself to a life of crime.
She wasn't making this any easier on herself.
Don't play dumb with me, Kayla. Prim's tome!
Hah. You're a bit late on the uptake, Theo.|I've already transformed Prim's tome into something much grander!|Behold!

With something like that in her possession,|the dame was obviously connected to someone up high.|But I had a job to finish.|Though she tried to fight back, I cuffed her and brought her to the station.
This was on Sam's plate now.|Too bad about Miss Prim's tome...|but my job here was done.|Another case closed by Private Eye Theo Sphinx.

name: Training
commands: I've got you now, Ulver!|Your evil will be vanquished from this earth!
I'm not here to chit-chat, kid.
You attack without plan... leaving yourself wide open.
Damn! Where did that come from.
You are too focused on your own movement.|That is not the Rusonoon monks' style.
What would you know of the Way of the Blade?|It's a sacred art that only expresses itself clearly in self-defense!
Many solstices ago...{w}{clear}As he would say, read your opponent's movements, and yours will follow.|Combat is a dance.|Turn your opponents energy against them...
Here. Pay attention to me, not your sword.
Attacking trees will not improve your swordsmanship.|Meet me here tomorrow when the sun is halfway down the western sky.
Uh... Yeah.|Sure, I guess!|I'll be ready!

name: Turn1
commands: I'm sure there's a rational explanation.
There's not really any time for rational explanatations, Sam.|We need to move.

name: Intro
commands: # Remove the one unit that's in the screenspace
If all goes well today, this'll be my last premission spiel.
Anyways, with Vagnius dead, there's only one obstacle left in our way.|Duke Ulver himself.
Once he's been captured, and Althea takes the throne,|Kerala will be independent once more.

Everything we've dreamed of.|Everything we've fought for.|It all comes down to today.|Kiley's army assaults the gates of Rajas at dawn.|While the main Imperial garrison is occupied,|we will sneak into the Palace and eliminate the Duke.
With their leader incapacitated, and Kerala rising up in rebellion around them,|the remaining Imperials will be forced to surrender.
Okay... But how are we going to sneak in?|Ulver has Rajas locked down tight.

Luckily, Coyote knows of a secret passage below Rajas,|built during the time of the Sun King.|According to him, the passage leads directly to the Lion Throne.|It's been so long since anyone's used it, I'm sure it'll be abandoned.
Well then, we don't have long.
Quite right.|Everyone, this is your last chance to prepare. Make it count.
Are you sure we're going the right way, Coyote?
I mean, I don't want to cast doubt on your judgement, partner...|But I reckon' I've seen that exact rat before.
Joel, quit your whining and stay alert.|Our exit should be nearby.|Once we're there, I'll--
Coyote, you said this passage was abandoned.
Ugh...|Everyone, be on your guard.|We don't want any surprises.
What could be the purpose of all this?
Purpose...|A bird does not wonder if its purpose is to fly.
No time for philosophy, my friend. Prey is afoot!
Hmm? Did you hear something, Jakin?
What's a nice girl like you doing in the undercity?
O-Out of our way!|We need to get to the palace!

Hahaha! Such vigor!|I'll take pity on you, little girl.|You want to cross these waters, you have to play our game.|There's only one rule.|If you can make it by us alive, then you're free.|Otherwise, well... Hahaha!.
What sort of sick game is this...
The greatest of games!|You just have to bet your life to play!|Hahaha!
Come on Jakin. Let's scram.|We've got to give them a fighting chance, after all.
Who the hell were those jokers...
Never mind that.|We must be right under the palace.|There should be an exit nearby.|Stay together, and we might make it out of this 'game' alive.

name: Outro
commands: # From this point on, all enemies are at +2 level
Phew... Those jokers would not let up.|Who were they anyway, Sam?
Now is not the time for conjecture.|Duke Ulver himself is beyond these doors.
Ulver will rue the day he reckoned with us.
Let's go then. Our final battle awaits.

name: Turn1
commands: Duke Ulver sends his regards.|He regrets to inform you that he is occupied at the moment.
Duke Ulver is well aware of your plans.
My boy, do not fret.|The Duke has graciously decided to provide you with...|alternative entertainment.
How astute.|With that kind of acumen, it's no wonder you've come so far.{w}{clear}Well, I'm off to more important matters.|The Duke will see you in a bit...|If you can survive that long.
Oh... I've blundered.|To think we could take on the Duke.|It was a pipe dream all along.
Sam, I doubted you once.|But no longer.|We couldn't have made it this far without your leadership.|But that means you can't give up now.|Together, we'll finish this.
# Now it cycles through remaining characters final quotes
I ain't usually one for waxin' sentimental,|but it's not everyday you take on the might of the Empire.|Bein' in the Resistance ain't easy,|but I wouldn't trade it for anythin'.
I can never thank you all enough.|I will try my best!
To restore Althea to the throne...|My life is nothing in comparison to such a glorious goal.
They don't stand a chance with me on your side.
To be a part of history.|I never imagined such an end.
You're all idiots.|But you're my idiots!|I won't let you down.
Tsk tsk. We'll pull through.|I guarantee it.
If we give it our all...|Well, by the light, what are we waiting for!|Let's go!

name: Turn5
commands: # Attack nearby units and move toward allies
Hmmph.|I grow tired of this game. Let's finish this then.
You have my attention.|Come and fight. May the strongest triumph!
Everyone.|This is it. This is our chance.|Everyone outside is counting on us.|Kiley's army, the people of Podoma, and Kerala itself.|One last push. Give it your all.

name: Intro
commands: Milord, the insurgents have breached the North Gate.
Hmmm.|Tell Commander Praetos to move his forces there.|Push those rebels back.
Milord, I'm receiving reports of an insurgent group below the Palace.
You know best, milord.|Should I send out the Palace Guards?
No... Leave them here. Let the Resistance come.
If they have finally worked up the nerve to attack me directly...|Well, let them try.|They will find it easier said than done.
Are you sure that's wise, milord?

They were too much for my underlings to handle.|Brigham, Marduk, Vagnius.|All of them met their match against the Resistance.|I say that the Resistance have earned their right to challenge me.|I will finish them myself, ending their nuisance once and for all.|They will die with their honor intact, at least.
The strong must be gracious to the weak, Adjutant.|This is one of the prime teachings of the Empire.
Well then, I will allow the Resistance to pass.
Let us see how they fare.
It looks like we made it after all.|Coyote's passage dropped us right in the center of the palace.|Ulver should be beyond those doors.
Then what are we waiting for?
I'll never get over that kid's unnatural enthusiasm.|Oh well, better to die with hope than despair...

name: Outro
commands: I can't believe we did it.|We defeated... the Duke.
Did you feel that, Sam?|It's like a great weight was lifted...
Let's regroup and make our way outside.|We must tell Rajas--|nay, all of Kerala.
# Ophie, Sam, Althea meet with Kiley outside the city
Aye, the announcement came just in time.|We were weathering their assault,|but they were threat'ning to push us out of the city...
I'd never seen anything like it.|With Ulver's death, I felt a wicked spasm go through me.|I guess everyone did.

It was a human tide--|The Keralans picked up their hatchets and pikes and took to the streets.|There was a bit of butchery for a moment,|but then the remaining soldiers surrendered.|Hah! Even Imperials know how to save their own skins.
It's like a dream.|Kerala free from the Imperials.

Erm... Perhaps,|but there's still so much work to be done.|We need to get you on the throne.|The Confederacy needs to formally recognize our independence.|The Keralan border towns still need to be liberated...
The Empire is not going to take this lying down.
Aye, lass.|But that's what you have me and my boys for.|We ain't gonna let any dirty Imperials just walk in here like last time.
Sam, you're right.|There's still so much work to do.|But we can do this.|With you all at my back, we'll rebuild Kerala into what it once was.
I'll be off then.|I've got an army to take care of.|And you all have your own problems to attend to.
This chapter of our story is over.
But another one is starting right before us.
Well, no use standing around if we've got things to do!

name: Final
commands: Prim, do you think I look alright?|I didn't forget a button, did I?
Althea, don't worry. You look great!|Don't be so nervous!|This is your coronation!|It's supposed to be a celebration.
Easy for you to say.|Everyone's looking up to me.|What happens if I forget what I'm going to say?|Or worse, what if I trip on my way to the throne?
You won't trip.|Don't worry about it.
Prim, please stop fussing over Althea.|You're just going to get her more flustered.
Yep. Just in time, too.|Didn't want to miss your coronation.
How did the meeting go, Chancellor?
The Confederacy agreed to a formal defense pact.|In no small part due to Kayla's armtwisting.
What can I say, I'm very persuasive.
Tsk tsk, you don't have to thank me, your majesty.|Success is its own reward.
It's only been a month, and yet everything's changing so fast.
I feel the same way.|Without the Resistance--|Well, sometimes I feel like there's something missing.
But you have your new job.|You're our chancellor, Althea's our queen,|Kiley's a general, Kayla's our chief diplomat...
You don't know what you're going to do next?
For so long,|following in the footsteps of the monks was my dream.|Then, it was to help the Resistance free Kerala.|But now...
Ophie, you've been quiet.|What are you planning to do?
Huh? Oh me... well, actually I was planning on leaving.
There's so much more out there... even beyond Kerala.|I want to see the world.
I'll be here through your coronation, Althea.|And then I'm off... Coyote gave me a map.|That man has contacts all over the place.|It'll be an adventure!
But don't worry, Prim.|I'll be back again.
But anyway, Althea, looks like the ceremony's starting.|Try to enjoy yourself.
Then get going. Everyone's waiting on you.
We'd best be going ourselves.|If we want to be able to see the ceremony at least.
In case I don't see you after the coronation,|it's been an honor serving with you--
No need to be so formal, Sam.|With what we've been through...
Don't rush on our account, Ophie.|There's a whole world out there...|and you've already done so much for Kerala.
Well, what do I always say...|No use waiting around! Let's go!
Coyote traveled with Kiley, ridding Kerala of the remaining Imperial forces. Once that job was done, he melted back into the shadows, with nary a trace.
Kayla got that promotion she'd been angling for. As head of the Confederacy's Diplomacy Corps, she continues to fight against the Empire's ambitions at every turn.
After the revolution, Sam formally accepted the position of Althea's Chancellor. He now helps Althea guide Kerala towards a better future.
After many moons training with the renascent Rusonoon monks, Eliza's fiery temperament cooled. However, her quest to become stronger never ceased.
Theo was ever thankful for an end to all the fighting. One could often find him perusing Rajas's great library, when he's not curled up with a good book.
Renae continued her quest, stealing from the rich and giving to the needy. And if she took a little bit off on the side, well, who would notice?
Althea ascended to the throne of Kerala with widespread fanfare. However, she has not forgotten the sacrifices of her friends and countrymen.
Drake never faltered in his watch over the fledgling queen. His unceasing devotion and unflinching fortitude was a boon to Althea's successful reign.
Nia disappeared into the forest, and was seldom seen again. Yet, there are rumors of a phantom in Kerala's forests who guides wayward travelers home.
Never one to rest on his laurels, Joel continued to fight for Kerala's freedom in Kiley's army. He could always be counted on to raise his squad's spirit.
Prim soon found her place working with the Rusonoon Monastery reconstruction effort. She now spends her time guiding amateur monks on the path of righteousness.
Although hailed as a hero in Kerala, Ophie soon found himself wishing for more. He departed soon after Althea's coronation, in search of adventure.
